abstract.p: By Design column discusses boots that are both stylish and practical; drawing (S)

block.p: Winter usually means rain, snow and such and calls for protective footwear. There are plenty of bad-weather boots that are both stylish and practical.
The Patrick Cox boutique at 702 Madison Avenue (62d Street) has knee-high rain boots with chunky mid-high heels in glossy red, green, gold, brown, beige, black, gray or navy ($90).

Saks Fifth Avenue stocks DKNY's rain shoes and zip-front low boots in black or white rubber ($65 and $85), Hush Puppies' black or brown suede midcalf boots ($130) and Aquatalia by Marvin K's side-zipped black suede boots ($160).

Bloomingdale's has Stuart Weitzman's short black leather-tipped suede boots ($205), Vincini's brown nylon with fake-fur lining ($225), Bally's quilted leather ankle boots ($395) and Bottega Veneta's shearling lace-ups ($340).
Searle has shearling-lined sleek black leather boots and lace-up ankle boots (both $225).
